location: ERIE HOSPITAL FOR THE CRIMINALLY INSANE

text: CAMERA MOVES THROUGH a tangled jungle of razor wire, fina COMING INTO VIEW of a foreboding, fortress-like old  institution, surrounded by towers and gun turrets.  Screa and horrible laughter is heard from within... CLOSE ON a sign that reads "Erie Hospital for the Crimina Insane" ...This is where the worst killers and psychos go.

THE CAMERA PANS THE EXPRESSIONLESS FACES of the REVIEW BO as CASANOVA FRANKENSTEIN sits across from them.  Dressed an immaculately tailored prison smock (with "Casanova"  exquisitely embroidered above the pocket), he sits contri as DOCTOR EMMET BIERCE, the hospital's fatherly Chief of  Psychiatry, presents his case.
No one can deny the horrendous nature  of Mr. Frankenstein's crimes, but in  the twenty years he has been with  us, I have never seen a patient turn  his energies to more productive use.
CASANOVA, the picture of remorse and repentance.

Just look at his accomplishments...  three volumes of poetry, two rock  operas, a sculpture garden, four  romance novels... and who can forget  his touching portrayal of Billy  Bigelow in our all-psychotic  production of "Carousel"...
ON SEVERAL OF THE BOARD getting misty eyed at the memory that brilliant performance...
Directed by our own Doctor Anabel  Leek.

ON DOCTOR ANABEL LEEK, the hospital's icily beautiful, ul cool, top shrink. A moment later Casanova addresses them... His manner is  charming, sincere, his voice soft, filled with emotion. is a master of seduction.

Twenty years ago I was a lost soul.  Loveless... (with a son-like glance  at Doctor Bierce) Fatherless... (chokes on the word) A... psycho! (breaks down sobbing) Oh!  How could I have done it? The  murder... the mayhem... all of those  lovely young girls! (weeping, a brilliant  performance) I'm sorry! I'm SO SO SORRY!
Doctor Bierce wipes the tears from his eyes. Reactions fr the board, moved, as Casanova weeps convulsively.  Doctor Leek shows no reaction.

(pulls himself together) But my deeds have been done, and my  youth is gone, and we can only go  forward in this cruel world... and  if I have learned anything from my  wretched life it is that... When you  walk through a storm, keep your head  held high... (singing) And don't be afraid of the dark...
Tears plop dawn the cheeks of the review board as the FUL

head_text.subj: ORCHESTRATED STRAINS OF "WHEN YOU WALK THROUGH A STORM"

text: A hand stamps Casanova's file "CURED"... Casanova shakes  hands and embraces the tearful members of the review boar finishing with a paternal hug from Doctor Bierce. In his cell a guard delivers Casanova his favorite old di suit (that's been waiting far him for twenty years). Casanova, dressed in the suit, walks down the central ais of the lock-up... A moment later he steps out of the mass gates of the hospital, and takes his first deep breath of freedom... while in an office window high above Bierce an the members of the review board stand watching, very prou But suddenly THE MUSIC CHANGES TO SEVENTIES DISCO as a bl Ferrari drives up, and Doctor Leek, now dressed very sexi gets out... As the review board watches in stunned silenc Casanova and Anabel perform a nifty little disco twirl,  finishing with a very lewd kiss... Bierce, watching, realizes he's been duped... as Casanova grinning up at him, puts a long gold chain (his favorite  weapon) around his neck... Bierce, horrified, picks up the telephone... as Casanova Anabel get in the car.
Casanova and Anabel drive off. The massive old hospital i seen through the rear window behind them, as Casanova cal looks at his watch...
as the second hand just swings toward the twelve. It is  exactly twelve noon...
(almost wistfully) Boom.
And the hospital EXPLODES in a HUGE FIREBALL that complet consumes it.
Those gas leaks can be murder.

The Ferrari drives past and the CAMERA HOLDS ON a sign th reads "We1come to Champion City, home of Captain Amazing" The city itself, a crumbling rust belt metropolis (ala  Detroit) can be seen stretched out along the shore of Lak Champion off in the distance...
I'm home.

The Ferrari drives under a much larger billboard that loo over the road, showing a picture of Captain Amazing himse a square jawed classic superhero, staring fiercely into t camera. The caption reads "Crime. Don't even think about  it."

Letters read "Six months later"... as the CAMERA EXPLORES the desolate muddy terrain of the train yards, CRUISING p piles of tires and abandoned train cars... CAMERA PICKS UP a battered van as it drives through the y then pulls up beside an old boxcar. The back of the van i thrown open, a ramp is thrown down, and THE RED EYES, a g of vicious small time thieves (all of whom wear sunglasse with red lenses) start unloading their night's haul... RE EYE 1 drives a golf cart, with clubs, down the ramp.
Golf anyone?

Several more Red Eyes emerge carrying a sawn off bike rac with bikes still attached, a barber pole, a Virgin Mary l statue, and a top of the line baby stroller... while thei leader, BIG RED, stands in the door to the boxcar, watchi approvingly.
Not a bad night's work.
Who said crime don't pay?
The Red Eyes laugh... as Red Eye 3 takes the cover off th baby stroller and sees... that there's a BABY still in it
Hey, Boss, we got a stowaway.
The crooks gather around the baby, a jolly little kid who just laughs at them.
(about to slug him) Who you laughin' at, punk?
He's just a tyke. Lighten up.
He's kinda cute.
If you like drool.
Hey, why don't we sell him back to  his parents? For a million bucks!
The others think that's a great idea, but Big Red doesn't
And what if he rats on us?
The others hadn't thought of that.
So what should we do with him?
Stick a brick in his Pampers and  dump him in the lake.
The others think that's a good idea and look around for a brick.
Come on, kid, you're goin' for a  swim.
But suddenly there is another presence... A man in a blue turban and cape with the initials "BR" on his chest has  appeared... He is THE BLUE RAJA.
Not so fast, gentlemen -- and I use  the term loosely... Unhand that  youngster...
Another man steps into the light. He wears a construction helmet and mask. There is an "S" on his chest, and he car an old shovel. He is THE SHOVELER.
Or you're mulch.
He brandishes his shovel for effect. The Red Eyes look at these two, highly amused.
What are you guys supposed to be...  superheroes?

A third man steps out. His costume is less dramatic than others. He wears only an old leather jacket and a faded, torn shi with flames on it, but the fierce look on his face and th atrociousness of his haircut make it very clear that he i the craziest and most dangerous of the three. He is MISTE FURIOUS.
We ARE superheroes!
Really? Did you mother make those  costumes?
The crooks howl with laughter.
This is our territory. Beat it.
Over YOUR dead body.
Big Red turns to the others and shakes with pretended fea
0ooooo, he's scary.

The Red Eyes laugh, but suddenly, a small silver projecti whizzes through the air and implants itself in Big Red's  backside. He howls with pain, pulls it out and examines i It's a silver dessert fork.
A fork!
The Raja holds up his hands, each of which hold a spread silver forks.
And there's plenty more where that  came from.

Big Red gives a shrill whistle, and a dozen more Red Eyes step out of an old caboose... including MIKEY, a four hun pound behemoth. He is eating a container of Ben and Jerry like it was an ice cream cone, taking huge bites out of i container and all. RAJA AND SHOVELER, reacting... Gulp. This was more than t bargained for. But Furious just growls; he's game.
GET 'EM!

The Red Eyes attack... Mister Furious goes into a furious face; his hair stands out straight and he rushes right in the oncoming crooks... A Red Eye takes a swing at the Shoveler -- but he simply  puts up his shovel and lets the crook slug the shovel's p The crook yelps with pain and shakes his battered hand... the Raja fends off crooks, poking them with salad forks.. and the baby sits in his stroller, watching and laughing, really enjoying the show. (There's no real martial artist or teamwork here; this is a classic back alley brouhaha.) But there's too many of then... The Raja goes down under  swinging fists... and so does the Shoveler... Furious holds his own, taking out crooks with powerful le and rights -- until Mikey runs him down like a truck, fal right on top of him and crushing him under his massive we
Crush him, Mikey!... Mash him!...  Mush him!
(barely audible under  all that meat) Is that all you got?
He wants more!... Squish him!...  Finish him off!
(faintly) Your mother!
Mikey, sweating, bears down... but suddenly, a calm, very authoritative voice is heard.
Is there a problem?

Everything suddenly stops, as the Red Eyes look up and se CAPTAIN AMAZING standing on tap of the boxcar, hands on h framed in the light at the moon, his biceps bulging, his  state of the art physique sculpted body armor gleaming in the moonlight, his cape wafting heroically in the wind. H is superhero perfection incarnate. ON THE RED EYES as their viciousness turns instantly to  panic...
IT'S CAPTAIN AMAZING!

Big Red and a couple others try to run for it, but Amazin leaps cat-like off the boxcar and is on them in a flash. the baby claps his hands in delight, and our three heroes watch in beat-up awe, Amazing deftly takes out the crooks with expert punches and effortlessly delivered elbows and kicks. He is the consumate superhero, and he doesn't even break a sweat. The remaining Red Eyes drop to their knees and throw up t hands in surrender.
We give!... We're sorry!... We had  terrible childhoods! (Etc.)

Police cars and a TV truck come screeching into the train yard... and the scene is suddenly flooded with light and  swarming with cops and reporters... Our three heroes try to approach Captain Amazing (who sti looks fresh as a daisy).
Nice work, Captain.
But Amazing just walks past them, ignoring them completel as if they didn't even exist. He goes to greet DAWN WONG  (Champion City's answer to Connie Chung).
(turning on the old  superhero charm) Hi. Dawn.
(putty in his hands,  pudding in his bowl) Looks like you've done it again,  Captain.
It's what I do.
Our heroes just watch, feeling ignored, humiliated. Furio growls. Suddenly, TWO COPS are accosting them.
Okay, show's over. Move it. On your  way.
Wait a minute, Officers. You don't  understand -- we're superheroes, and  we just busted up this gang.
Really? Let me guess -- you're Towel  Head and he's... (meaning the Shoveler) Captain Pooper Scooper!
The cops crack up. Furious growls at them. The cops yank their nightsticks.
Hey! Move it!
Get a life!
And leave crime fighting to the real  thing!
Shoveler and Raja pull Furious away before he gets into r trouble... The cops watch as our three heroes disappear into the nig
Wannabes.
Pathetic.
An inner city greasy spoon.

on which Captain Amazing, the laughing baby in his arms, being interviewed by Dawn Wong. He's playing the cutsy ph op for all its worth, gootchy-gooing the kid, etc. Dawn i creaming. Our three heroes sit at a booth in the back of the diner, watching the tube...
(nursing a sore jaw) He doesn't miss a trick, does he?
What a jerk -- and like nobody knows  who he really is!
Oh don't start that again --
LOOK!

Furious picks up the newspaper on which there is a photo a good looking guy in a tux at a benefit... The headline  reads "Lance Hunt Hosts Benefit." He holds the picture up next to the television, so the faces of Lance Hunt and Ca Amazing are side by side. It is obviously the same guy.
He's Lance Hunt! Just take off the  glasses -- and it's him!
There's a vague similarity.
A vague similarity? IT'S THE SAME  GUY!
(downing some aspirin) Oh, who gives a damn who he is? I  can't take this anymore. Night after  night we're on the streets, busting  our humps -- and for what?
We take the licks and he gets the  chicks.
How long do you have to chase a dream  before you realize it's not gonna  happen?
We need a break, that's all! Nobody'd  ever heard of him until he busted  Casanova Frankenstein!
But look at him... and look at us.
The camera loves him.
A depressed silence. Furious turns his attention to the n dispenser.
(furious) Why do they always fill stuff these  things so full you can't pull 'em  out without ripping 'em! (rips one out)
I lost another fork tonight. She's  getting suspicious, I know it.
So why don't you just tell her!
I can't.
Why not?
(upset) Because I can't! Okay? She wouldn't  understand!
Leave him alone. She's his mother,  not yours.
We had an off night, that's all.
So when are we gonna have an on night?
A WAITRESS is standing at the table.
Hi.
They look at her, taken aback. She's very pretty.
You're... new.
It's my first night. My name's Monica.
CLOSE ON FURIOUS, smitten by her, but almost afraid to lo at her. Under all that rage, he's in fact shy.
You guys going to a costume party?
We're superheroes.
Really? Like Captain Amazing?
Furious growls.
Are you famous?
Not yet.
So you're like... struggling  superheroes?
We prefer to think of ourselves as  unsung... I am the Blue Raja, Master  of Silverware... (does a very impressive  little flipping thing  with his place setting)
Wow.
And these are my associates, the  Shoveler.
Hi.
And Mister Furious... His anger is  his power.
(intrigued by Furious) Really?
Usually a superpower is a magical  endowment or a great skill. In his  case, it's entirely emotional.
So what can I get you?
Burgers all around. (meaning himself) Medium. (meaning the Shoveler) Rare. (meaning Furious) Raw.
A moment later as Monica walks away, Furious can't help b watch her. The Raja replaces the diner's dinnerware with good stuff from his coat.
She likes you.
Definitely.
Ask her out.
Nah.
Roy, when was the last time you had  an actual date?

(getting very pissed  off) What does it matter? Women just want  to control you -- and talk about  their feelings. They want to know  why you're angry all the time -- and  what can they can do to help -- so  you tell them there's nothing --  nothing -- just leave me alone --  but they bug you and they bug you  and they bug you -- until you just  can't stand it anymore! -- so you  finally open up -- you pop like a  blister -- and it all comes spewing  out -- all your emotions -- your  feelings -- your fears -- all of it! (after a beat) And then they dump you.
So you're chicken?
(fiercely) Who's chicken? (gets up)

Monica stands at the counter placing her order. Furious  approaches her, leans against the counter. For a moment h just stands there, fuming, unable to think of anything to say. She isn't sure what to make of this.
Doesn't it piss you off the way the  when you really want to talk to  somebody you can't think of anything  to say!
I guess... Are you always so angry?
Only when I'm awake... You busy after  work?
She shrugs.
Want to go out and get drunk?
She's visibly turned off by that.
Or talk?
Not tonight. (picks up an order  and walks away)
Furious, the Raja, and the Shoveler step out.
Maybe you should try a more romantic  approach.
(gets on his old Harley) Like what? Cutting off my own ear?
Or flowers.
See ya tomorrow.
Furious kicks his engine started and speeds off into the  night as the Shoveler opens the door of his battered Ford Esquire station wagon, and the Raja gets into his ancient Datsun.
The Shoveler pulls into the driveway of his very modest h The front yard looks like a battle zone. Bikes and kids'  junk are everywhere.

as big a disaster area as the front yard. His kids, EDDIE JR. (15), LENORE (12), BUTCH (10), TRACY (7), and ROLAND are all sprawled in front of the television. The Shoveler enters, and his kids don't even bother to look up from th tube.
Hey, when are you guys gonna clean  this place up?
When you're on TV.
Right -- like that will ever happen.
Save any babies lately?
ON THE SHOVELER, silent, hurt.
Faster than a speeding turtle --
More powerful than a deodorant --
Able to eat twelve donuts in a single  sitting --
Look, snoring in his chair --
Sitting on the john --
It's... Supergut!
The kids all laugh (in that derisive way that kids do so  well) as the Shoveler dejectedly walks into the kitchen.
The Shoveler enters, dejected. His wife, Lucille, is doin the dishes. She looks up, sees him.
(feels for him) Rough night, Eddie?
He nods.
The Raja's Datsun is parked in front of a neat as a pin l Victorian house.

The room is dark. Someone is sneaking around. A drawer is quietly opened, and we hear the gentle clink of silver.  Suddenly, the light goes on and we see the Blue Raja, now dressed in a sport shirt and slacks, with his hand in the drawer. His MOTHER, in her nightclothes, stands by the do where she has just switched on the light.
Jeffrey!
Oh hi, Mom.
What are you doing in the silver  drawer?
Looking for... the TV Guide.
She just looks at him, very suspicious.
It's on the television.
Of course. I'm such a fool... Thanks,  Mummy.
Go to bed. He kisses her and goes into the next room. CAMERA HOLDS O MOM; she doesn't trust him.

A billboard overlooking the city. Captain Amazing is pose wearing a pair of bright blue Nikes. The caption reads. " a nice world. Somebody's got to save it... The Nike Super It's Amazing." Furious sits on his Harley, taking long hauls from a pint bottle of cheap bourbon and gazing up at the sign.

Amazing? What's so amazing about  him? I'd be amazing, too, if I'd  inherited two hundred million bucks...  or two bucks... or two cents... (hurls the empty  bottle, smashing it  against the sign) Who am I kidding? Dreams don't come  true.
A moment of despondency, and then he hears a strange soun overhead and looks up...
as something suddenly flies across the star filled night above him... It is Captain Amazing, wearing a high tech rocket pack on his back...
Where's he going? (kicks his Harley  started)

as Furious, following Captain Amazing, rides roughshod do the steep hill, skidding onto a road and then speeding th a residential area... He cuts onto some railroad tracks, hops his bike up on a  rail, and rides smoothly along it, following Amazing... H turns off the tracks, rides roughly through some woods, t emerges from the trees and sees.. A foreboding looking old mansion... Captain Amazing lands the highest part of its roof... Furious pulls up, gazes a the front gates of the mansion...
Letters across the iron gates read... "Frankenstein".

Captain Amazing abandons his jet pack and moves across th old slate roof like Spiderman, leaping nimbly from gable gable and walking along a high ridge like a tight rope wa Finally he approaches a skylight, looks down and sees... A huge old library with an iron catwalk running around it Casanova Frankenstein sits in a club chair by a roaring f Anabel perches on the arm of his chair. In the other chai sits a once good looking, now paunchy guy, with a meticul coifed haircut. He is TONY POMPADOUR, head of the infamou Disco Boys.
(just as he suspected) Uh-huh.
He sees that the skylight is open, and quietly lets himse in...
Casanova and Tony P savor glasses of brandy and puff on b cigars.
I hope you enjoy these cigars. I had  to kill a dozen Cubans to get them.
Ummm.
Have you considered my offer?
You know, Mr. F, me and the boys  always loved workin' for you. You  had such style: the clothes, the  dancin', the elegant way you'd snuff  a babe. You were the King...
Casanova accepts this graciously.
But times have changed, and you been  in that bug house a long tine. I can  see you still got the style, but I  dunno for sure you still got the  edge.
I got it.
What about Captain Amazing?
Good question.

Casanova and Tony P look up and see Captain Amazing, pose noncalantly on the iron catwalk, gazing down at them. Ton jumps out of his chair, scared. But Casanova just smiles his ancient rival, cool as a cucumber.
I knew you'd come. I left that  skylight open for you.
I know you did.
I knew you'd know.
I know you knew I'd know.
But did you know I knew you'd know  I'd know?
Of course.
Tony P makes a move for his pistol, but Captain Amazing  instantly whips out his pistol, getting the drop on him.
I'd hate to waste a good bullet on a  piece of scum like you, Tony.
Tony freezes.
The jig is up, Casanova. I've spent  six months watching you, and know  exactly what you're up to.
Really?
I know that you're recruiting your  old henchmen...
Nervous reaction from Tony P.
I know who your girlfriend really  is...
Icy reaction from Anabel.
And I know the terrible revenge that  you plan to inflict on this city.
I guess you know just about  everything, don't you, Lance?
Um-hmm.
Except for one little thing.
(supremely confident) And what's that?
That I've hot wired the city's entire  power supply through that catwalk.
What --?
Casanova suddenly throws a secret breaker switch, and the ugly hum of a million volts instantly fills the room...

still watching... as all the lights in the house go out,  except for a frightening orange glow in an upper room... Off in the distance Furious sees... the lights of the ent city flicker and then black out... A moment later the man and the city's lights return to normal... as Furious watc not sure what to make of this.
Traffic is snarled. Horns are blasting. Tempers are fraye

head_text.subj: A HAMMERING JACKHAMMER... CAMERA WIDENS TO REVEA

text: that it is being operated by the Shoveler, dressed in wor clothes. Wiped out from the night before, the vibrations the hamer are lulling him off to sleep... He nods out... his BOSS whacks him on the arm.
YO! CAPTAIN SOMINEX! Get your shut- eye at home, or you'll be a full  time superhero!
The Raja lies sprawled on his bed, depressed, still in hi pee jays, as he watches... an ANTHONY ROBBINS infomercial THE TV.
It's all within your power. The only  thing that's in your way is YOU!
Easy for you to say.
An auto junkyard and demotion yard.

A giant press mashes an old car... while nearby Mister Fu does the job by hand, demolishing an old Grand Prix with iron bar. He does it as easily as a normal guy would tear apart a corrugated box, ripping off the doors, then teari off the bumpers and the hood and tossing the pieces onto big pile... His big boned, red faced boss SALLY is callin out to him.
Hey, Roy!

In a weedy overgrown far corner of the junkyard Sally and Furious stand looking a big old hunk of a military vehicl It is a Herkimer Battle Jitney, a heavily armored, window soundproof, personnel carrier (designed by the Pentagon in the fifties to take congress on battlefield fact finding tours). Overgrown with weeds, home to an extended family of pigeons, its fighting days it ever had any) are over.
How many times I gotta tell you about  this?
Sally, that's a Herkimer Battle  Jitney! They don't make 'em like  that anymore. It's a classic!
It's a hunk of junk. I want the iron.  Do it!
She walks away. Furious growls. He picks up his iron bar is about to wedge it under the front bumper of the Herkim

But the big old headlights and the sad old grill seem to looking at hint, imploring him for one last chance... And he just can't do it. He throws away his iron bar and  climbs inside the cab of the Herkimer...
Furious sits behind the wheel and tenderly touches its be up old dashboard, then turns on the radio, which, miracul still works. He tunes in a local station, puts his feet up on the dash
...and continues to deny any knowledge  of the incident... In local news,  millionaire Lance Hunt has apparently  disappeared...
ON FURIOUS, taking immediate notice.

Members at his household told police  that the playboy philanthropist failed  to return home last night after "going  out for a walk". Police say they  have no reason yet to suspect foul  play, but a search is under way...
Furious, the Shoveler, and the Raja all sit at their boot
I saw him go in -- and he didn't  come out!
But we don't know for sure it's the  same guy.
Furious groans.
Hey, look.
Casanova is being interviewed by DON STOUFFER, the local  Mike Wallace.
Well, Don, I've done some terrible  things in my life, but now I'm cured,  and I just want to give back something  to my old home town... That's why  I'm using what's left of my fortune  to build...
CLOSE ON A MODEL of a huge concrete bunker-like instituti structure (i.e. the Getty).
The Frankenstein Center for the Arts.
You've changed, haven't you?
Oh yes.

head_text.subj: BACK ON FURIOUS, RAJA, AND SHOVELER -

text: No he hasn't.
the wall of the estate... as our heroes' three heads rise over it... and survey the grounds.
(about to climb over) Let's go.
(in a whisper, holding  him back) Wait!... Look!

A group of men are hanging around the door to the house,  smoking, chatting, and laughing. A CLOSER ANGLE REVEALS t they are all dressed in the height (or depths) of seventi disco fashion. One of them is showing off some steps. Our heroes fall back behind the safety of the wall and co
This is bad.
Who are they?
The Disco Boys.
The who?
The most vicious gang of thugs this  city ever produced. Twenty years ago  they were Casanova's personal  bodyguard. But after he was busted  they crawled into the woodwork.
Well they've crawled back out.
We may be getting in over our heads  here.
This looks like a job for Superman --
Or Batman --
Or both.
Don't you guys get it? If Captain  Amazing is still in there, we can  rescue him -- and get on TV! (goes right over the  wall)
They share an exasperated look, then scramble over the wa after him.

Casanova and Dr. Anabel Leek are preparing for bed. Anabe sits in front of a huge mirror, brushing her long hair as Casanova moves up behind her and puts his hands around he throat, massaging, squeezing, just barely resisting the  temptation to strangle her. (She loves it).
Everything's going exactly as we  planned.
(puts the sharp point  of her comb handle  under his chin) Not quite. You haven't announced our  engagement yet.
It must have slipped my mind.
Your mind is so slippery.

Don't worry, Pootchkie. My womanizing  days are over. You're my Lady Macbeth,  my Imelda... my Nicole. (pulls her into his  arms) We're such an incredible team. Who  could possibly stop us? (kisses her)
as they crunch their way non too stealthily across the  backyard.
Don't crunch the leaves.
Sorry.
Be a Mohican. (bumps into a lawn  chair)
Wait. (They all stop.) I hear something.

They all listen; there is a low rushing sound... It is th sound of water rushing through pipes. Suddenly, the lawn  sprinklers all pop up... and our heroes get drenched. The duck off the lawn, behind the cover of a large tree.
I'm soaked. (sneezes) Oh great.
Shhh.
Be a Mohican.
Shut up.
Furious sees a pair of French doors, off a small patio. O of the doors is slightly open.
Come on.
They start sneaking toward it, but as they cross the pati they trip the automatic security lighting, and suddenly f themselves bathed in light.
Uh-oh.
As our heroes look around as a dozen Disco Boys, armed wi pipes, chains, brass knuckles, step into the light and  encircle them... The French doors open and Tony P steps o
Oh I'm sorry. We must have the wrong  house.
You sure do.

The Disco Boys attack. The Raja is instantly clubbed down The Shoveler deflects only a blow or two with his shovel  before he goes down, too... These guys are not the Red Ey Only Furious holds his own. He grabs a pipe away from one them and swings fiercely, keeping the others off. Suddenl the Disco Boys pull back. Furious doesn't know why, until turns and sees... Casanova, standing right behind him, smiling.
Hi there.

With a cat-like move Casanova slashes his gold chain vici and repeatedly -- across Furious' face. Furious, stunned  with pain, lunges at Casanova, who neatly steps aside, th catches him with a fast combination of spinning disco kic Finally he lassos the chain around Furious' neck, and pul it tight, strangling him. ON THE DISCO BOYS, watching, snapping their fingers with  admiration... Casanova releases Furious, who slumps to the ground. Casa steps away, and the Disco Boys gather around Furious and  kick him viciously... as Casanova and Tony P watch, amuse chuckling.
Superheroes.
Should I kill them?
(completely disdainful) Why bother?
The Disco Boys drag our heroes through the gate and throw them like bags of garbage into the street... where they l in a moaning, agonized, semi-conscious heap.

Furious, rubbing his neck; a thin red mark runs around it The three of them are sitting at their usual table, in ve bad shape, moaning and groaning... Monica approaches. She made them ice packs and cold compresses.
Here you go. (sits with them,  applies a compress  to the Raja's head)
Ow.
Maybe you guys ought to forget this  Superhero stuff and join Kiwanis or  something.
A FUSSY CUSTOMER is calling out from another table.
Miss!
She moves off.
Maybe she's right.
